item.description:
The 12:45PM showing is "High Frame Rate - Real 3d". This is a three hour movie.

I'll be there 20 minutes before then (12:30). I'll be standing in the doorway to the right of the concession stand that leads to the arcade.

From wikipedia;

"Thomas Edison said that 46 frames per second was the minimum: "anything less will strain the eye.""

However;

"In the mid- to late-1920s, the frame rate for silent films increased to about 20 to 26 FPS."

and,

"From 1927 to 1930, the rate of 24 FPS became standard for 35 mm sound film".

The Hobbit was filmed at 48 frames per second, double what we usually see on the screen. This movie is worth watching even if that was the only thing to see.

New Zealand's scenery is also worth seeing.

Western MA Movie Meetup encourages carpooling to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from driving alone; it cuts emissions and cost in half. Please post your rides offered or needed using the rideshare group for our organization on Ridebuzz.org/Meetup On their site, when you post you'll be registered to win a bag of Ridebuzz Coffee from Dean's Beans.
item.name: The Hobbit - 12:30 PM on Sunday 1/6
